biography: Desiree D'Alessandro is an artist who earned her MFA in New Genres and Extended Praxes from UC Santa Barbara. Her work has been widely exhibited nationally and internationally in exhibitions at varying venues including museums, universities and film festival screenings. The conceptual frame in which she executes her recent work incorporates a methodology that emphases physicality and mobility. She has been recognized by contemporary artist Mark Dion as "an extraordinary artist dedicated to making art as a critical and intellectual procedure while exhibiting a rigor and vision of exceptional rarity." She loves laughing, vintage video games, and cats. She has a lovable feline named Leon.

biography: Kurt Kuersteiner is a former British Literature and Mass Communications adjunct professor who enjoys researching and writing about unusual and overlooked subjects. He is currently editing an extensive encyclopedia of classic radio horror and sci-fi shows, as well as a book on one of his favorite hobbies, monster cards. He previously published an authoritative book on the reclusive king of underground comics, "The Art of Jack T. Chick"  (Schiffer Publishing, 2004). He directed the documentary channel film on the same topic, "God's Cartoonist, The Comic Crusade of Jack Chick". He also directed "Church of the Subgenus: Sect? Satire? Or Satanism?" as his thesis film for the FSU College of Motion Picture Arts. He worked in television at the ABC affiliate in Harrisburg, PA. He founded Monsterwax, an independent trading card company that specializes in original art series.  He has written over 100 articles for The Wrapper magazine, and is lead owner/operator of one of Florida's most infamous haunted attractions (the Terror of Tallahassee).
name: Kurt Kuersteiner

biography: I (Dave Killingsworth) started doing game development over 25 years ago making add-ons for VGA Planets.  Started playing the game and then worked with a partner and developed the game add-ons. Those add-ons are still used today, 25 years later.  I love board and video games and have been wanting to make board games for as long as I can remember.I formed SolarFlare Games as an outlet for my desire to create and provide fun and entertainment to people.SolarFlare Games has successfully published Thrash-Car, Dumpster Brawl, Nightmare Forest: Dead Run, Nightmare Forest: Alien Invasion, Lords of Rock, Mosh Pit, Udder Terror and Archmage Origins via Kickstarter.Over the last three years we published three games with the Robotech IP. Force of Arms, Crisis Point and Invid Invasion.  Working with an IP was fun and exciting, but now we are going back to working with our own unique concepts.
name: Dave Killingsworth

biography:
About UP
UP is a brand founded by AAEON Technology Europe in 2015. The UP team is aiming to bring innovation in technology, business model, and integrated solution. With its agility, the UP team collaborate with market leaders in different vertical markets to bring integrated solutions and build a large online community to work closely with developers.
